metadata.titel_preek: Do You Want to Join the Miracle?

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from a world of controlled, closed explanations to a world of 'novum' (newness) through the light of Jesus, where the blind receive sight and the 'sighted' are revealed as blind.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus himself is the subject of this narrative.
He points to himself... and asserts, 'I am the light of the world'.
He puts mud on the eyes... tells him to wash.
a whole new mode of life
receiving a new world of possibility wrought by the power of God
inexplicable newness attributed only to God
wonders of God wrought in the real world

ontvanger.identificatie: The Blind Man (and by extension, the Hearer)
tekstueel_bewijs: the one who could not see now sees
The text... is an offer of newness.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is invited to identify with the Receiver (the blind man) but warned of being the Opponent (Pharisees).

tekstueel_bewijs: maddening in his persistence that is matched by his innocence
helper.rol_van_god: God/Jesus is the Subject who initiates; the man's testimony helps the narrative progress.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (The Light/Jesus) that enables sight.

tekstueel_bewijs: defenders of what is old and failed
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: They represent a systemic 'darkness' that attempts to defeat the 'light' and maintain a 'deathly' world.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response to the miracle: choosing to become a disciple and seeing the world differently.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (Jesus gives sight) enables the secondary program (the hearer choosing to see differently).

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus himself is the subject of this narrative.
He does enlighten the eyes of the blind man.
Jesus comes back into the narrative.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The Pharisees push the question back.

voorbeelden: You will have to deal with me.
Do you want to become his disciples?
We know how matters are to be settled.
One thing I know, that I was blind.
If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.
The darkness cannot finally defeat the light.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon frames the gospel as an epistemological crisis. Salvation is not 'doing' (Devoir) but 'seeing/knowing' (Savoir) the truth of Jesus.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Old controls) through ~S2 (The miracle) to S1 (The Light), while exposing that ~S1 is the true state of the authorities.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Light' which is ontologically superior to the darkness and cannot be defeated.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; S2 is described as 'deathly explanations' and 'frightened censorship'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. Jesus is the initiator of the 'novum'. The human role is 'receptiveness' rather than performance.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: To say 'yes' to that question... is to be there differently.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the source of possibility
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: receiving a new world of possibility wrought by the power of God
Nothing here about sin and guilt. Nothing here about morality or orthodoxy.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The blind man is a model, but specifically a model of 'receptivity' and 'persistence in testimony' rather than moral achievement.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already leans theocentric by emphasizing that the man's sight is a 'gift' he 'received'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is forced into a 'moment of self-recognition' across multiple roles, creating a healthy spiritual tension.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Grace is not just a status but a disruptive power that changes how one 'sees' reality.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon masterfully integrates the biblical narrative with contemporary epistemological struggles.
spanning_punten: The tension between Jesus as 'Subject' and Jesus as 'a problem that will not go away'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the darkness cannot finally defeat the light

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'Light' functions as the endowment of 'Pouvoir-voir' (power to see).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is defined as 'blindness'—the inability to see the 'Big Clue' to reality.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon correctly identifies Jesus as the primary Subject of the 'novum'. The actantial structure avoids moralism by making 'sight' a gift rather than a reward.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might identify too much with the 'conflicted' parts (parents/Pharisees) without moving to the 'Receiver' role.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: The Receiver (the one who is washed).
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the 'washing' (baptismal imagery) as something done *to* the hearer.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (The Spirit's power to enable the 'yes').
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly mention the Holy Spirit as the one who grants the 'Pouvoir-faire' to follow Jesus.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The sermon correctly places the 'gift of sight' (Soteriology) before 'discipleship' (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a profound example of a grace-oriented sermon that uses narrative structure to dismantle human self-sufficiency.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'talk show' metaphors, Greimas reveals the underlying power struggle between two 'worlds' (actants).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek; Greimas explains how the story 'works' on the hearer's identity.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Pharisees' are not just villains but a functional actant (Opponent) representing any closed system of knowledge.

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (points, asserts, puts mud, tells, comes back)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Light' as a semiotic equivalent to 'Grace'.
